summary: This is an email chain from April 2021 among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and an FBI agent regarding the preparation of a photo for discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The discussion involves stamping the photo as confidential, drafting a cover letter, and loading it to a drive for the defense.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery production; the photo is being prepared for her defense counsel.

events.title: FBI Agent sends photo for Maxwell discovery
events.description: An FBI agent from the New York Field Office sends a photo to be included in discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.

events.title: Preparation of Maxwell discovery production
events.description: US Attorney's Office personnel coordinate to stamp a photo as confidential, draft a cover letter, and load it to a drive for transmission to Maxwell's defense counsel.

keyFacts: In April 2021, the US Attorney's Office was actively managing discovery production for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.
A photo from an FBI agent was being processed, with discussions about stamping it as confidential.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between the US Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding evidence handling.
The document references a 'new drive for the MDC', indicating evidence was being stored or shared electronically for the defense.
The email chain involves multiple US Attorney's Office personnel, but their names are redacted.
